Text: Oh my goodness, can I give this place more stars? This little French bakery was near our Airbnb in Old Town, and I wish we hadn't waited until the last day of our trip to stop by! I got the hazelnut crepe, almond croissant, matcha macaron, and latte. The service was really nice, and everyone was so friendly. Everything was delicious, and I liked the crunch from the hazelnuts they added with the hazelnut crepe spread. The matcha macaron and latte were really good, but the best part was the almond croissant. It was DIVINE!! They put a delicious almond filling in the croissant, and the quality reminded me of the croissants I loved so much in Paris.One important thing to note is that you will need to put away your own trash and serving tray.If you're around the area, definitely stop by this cute little bakery!
Love this place. It's near my house and always delicious and authentic. Seems like most people working there are French and from the same family. Highly recommend their bread and pastries!

I love this place. Cute little french bakery on Wells street with amazing food. Very nice staff, the place is always clean, and it has a really cool rustic feeling to it. Definitely get the croque madame, and try their loaf of cheesy bread. You can't really go wrong at this place.
Amazing sourdough bread and price is competitive. Haven't tried their pastry yet but looked good! Great service as well.
Even though it says dog friendly on Yelp it is not. There is a sign at the door saying no pets allowed. Only service animals are allowed.

Love this place!  I go every week to get a latte and a pastry or crepe.  Delicious!  I've also enjoyed their soups and a ham a cheese croissant.  Prices are fair, service is friendly.  Highly recommend!
prev_text: Love this place!  I go every week to get a latte and a pastry or crepe.  Delicious!  I've also enjoyed their soups and a ham a cheese croissant.  Prices are fair, service is friendly and quick.  Highly recommend!

Text: Authentic and delicious! We started out with just breakfast (pain aux chocolate, almond croissant, pain aux raisins, and crepe "Suzette") and got lunch too (croque monsieur, quiche, and onion soup) since it was so good.
Incredible pastry. Best croissants I have ever had. Flaky, not greasy, not too sweet. Always recommend it to anyone visiting Chicago.
Really good and authentic macaroons. They're always fresh and have a pretty good selection of them. If you sign up for their reward, you get a free one on you're birthday!
This place is a gem. I've gone a couple times on Saturday mornings. They have a great window for people watching. You'll want everything, but I recommend you get the quiche.

This spot has the definition of excellent customer service. Michael, the one attending me, immediately went above and beyond to explain everything and give me recommendations. He had such a positive and friendly attitude, and even gave me some history to the place. Turns out, the owner won the World Baking Championship in the 90's and went on to open this cafe and bakeries around Chicago. I got the Hazelnut Beignet and an Iced Mocha (homemade mocha at that!) and both were super delicious. I mentioned that I had recently moved here and they told me Old Town residents get a little discount... Sweet! Definitely returning soon.Update: I've returned a few times and haven't been upset yet. I still get the mocha and now I have been getting the almond croissant. Oh. Em. Gee. First of all, the thing is huge and has toasted almonds and powdered sugar on top. There's a sweet almond rum paste/filling on the inside that is to-die-for. Get it warmed and you're set.
prev_text: This spot has the definition of excellent customer service. Michael, the one attending me, immediately went above and beyond to explain everything and give me recommendations. He had such a positive and friendly attitude, and even gave me some history to the place. Turns out, the owner won the World Baking Championship in the 90's and went on to open this cafe and bakeries around Chicago. I got the Hazelnut Beignet and an Iced Mocha (homemade mocha at that!) and both were super delicious. I mentioned that I had recently moved here and they told me Old Town residents get a little discount... Sweet! Definitely returning soon.

Text: They just made my day. Their mastery is in every pastry they made. If you wanna taste how the French bake, you visit this shop as early as possible before they are sold out.

I took my Mom here when she was in town and we got fresh bakes bread and a six pack of Macarons. Needless to say-- we ate ALL macaron in one sitting. It's so cute inside and the guys working the counter were so helpful! If you've never been, I highly recommend it.

My husband and I stopped here on a Friday morning before walking around Lincoln Park. The staff were super friendly (and French).It was very quiet and spacious inside, and there was no wait. He got one of the quiches of the day and said it was the best quiche he has ever had. I got a blueberry danish and it was so buttery, light, fresh and basiaclly amazing. Everything was moderately priced. This would be 5 stars but I wish they did more with their coffee menu, as we were just given small mugs to self-serve out of a container, which is fine, but I wasn't expecting it. I'd be here a lot if I lived in the area!
Average French pastries marketed as a classic French bakery.  Beignets lacked the density and richness of the best I've had, and the quiche was too moist.  Atmosphere fun with lovely staff.
Authentic French Patisserie in Old Town. Definitely worth a visit from a morning coffee and croissant to soups, sandwiches, salads and quiches for lunch.

Whoa baby, La Fournette you rock my world. Right across from Second City, this is my new go to after class snack. Side note: everyone should take an improv class at Second City once in their life! Anyways, the server greeted me in French and seemed genuinely excited to be there, which was refreshing. The case was pretty well staked around 2:30pm, and the almond croissant was crying my name, "Eat me Megan. Eat me!" I happily obliged and devoured it while walking to the train. Let it be known this is the best almond croissant I've had in my life thus far. It is a good size (possibly enough for two), and the almond filling is exquisite. It tastes like there may be some cointreau in there or some other liquor, maybe triple sec. Point is get the almond croissant and your tastebuds will sing for more!
Excellent crepes great atmosphere 5 star service! Large menu! Great for a afternoon snack, or breakfast. Opens at 7 am everyday!

Reasonably priced, delicious food, and a great atmosphere! We did not wait long to order or get our food. You can dine in or carry out. (Summer they have porch seating to eat outside). I used the Yelp check in deal to try their macaroons and it was very tasty. Staff was friendly and helpful with recommendations and questions. I would recommend this place.

What a little gem! Not only is the atmosphere authentically French, but so is the food. From the croissants, to the roulades, and the fantastic breads, La Fournette is one of my favorite cafés anywhere. I recommend starting your day with a café au lait and a pastry. I almost always take home one of their signature Miche bread loaves. The sourdough flavor is incredible. Intelligentsia coffee is served here.
Was treated to really great coffee & delicious almond croissant after hitting up a farmer's market. Cute decor & ambiance. Will definitely need to come back.

Authentic French bakery. Delicious chocolate eclair and raspberry beignet. Absolutely wonderful bread. I had a ham and cheese baguette and my daughter enjoyed her tuna salad sandwich. Excellent collection of french macarons-- mango passion, pista. Cointreau, chocolate and pina colado. Heavenly

Came in on an early Friday morning and it wasn't super busy but busy enough that there was a wait for our coffee and crepes. They have sweet or savory crepes. I got the veggie crepe which had spinach, cheese and egg. My husband got ham, cheese, and egg in his crepe. Both were very delicious. We also got a chocolate croissant which was also tasty. I'm not the biggest coffee connoisseur but I enjoyed my coffee just fine. The space isn't very big but there's plenty seating including some al fresco seating during warmer months.

A delicious French bakery in the heart of Old Town! They have all the classic baked goods, plus a delicious, if limited, selection of sandwiches. A great place to grab a coffee and a croissant! Nice staff and decent prices.

I ate here twice.  The macaroons, at least the lemon, are worth driving for.  The breads were good but I prefer the more chewy baguette (the French have both the light crispy more more American like bread and the more chewy and slightly more salty baguettes).  I prefer the latter.  Overall probably 4.5 stars.
We loved it here! The croissant and beignets were good and not too pricey. There are many other options, both savory and sweet.

If there's anything for which I have a weakness, pastries are on the top three list.  Thanks to other Yelpers, this place comes with very high reviews, and I was on a quest to find it.  The storefront is very narrow, and despite what GPS was telling me, I must've walked by this place at least a half-dozen times trying to find it, and felt really stupid when I finally did--it had a cute little awning inviting me in and made it more obvious.  In my defense, there is a lot of construction going on next to and in front of the store, so it made it a little tricky--that's my story; I'm sticking to it!First thing you notice when you walk in is how warm and inviting the place feels--a warm greeting from a staff member, the charming cafe feel that just beckons you to sit and stay a while and enjoy a croissant and coffee while you read the paper (remember those days?) and hopefully not a cellular device.  I took a few moments to peruse the display.  I think they noticed my drooling, because several workers behind the counter were helpful to offer service.  I chose an almond croissant, which was super-flaky, light, airy, and not just "good," but "OMG-good!"  I had to save my two little macarons for later, but trust me--I was dying to get into them.  I opted for a lychee and--?? (one other fruit that I can't remember), and a cassis. They were so good that I think I'm going back.  Okay, I'm lying.  I'm DEFINITELY coming back!  Where can I buy bigger pants?
Loved it.  Had an apple danish, almond croissant and a delicious cup of coffee.  The interior, the servers all added to the French cafe feeling.  Would absolutely stop here again.

I admire very much the French cuisine, so this place was a real breakthrough for me because it brought me a lot of joy. I really love French pancakes and croissants, these desserts take a special place in my heart it might seem funny but it's true. If your dream is to visit France then this place is exactly what you need, absolutely all desserts can virtually teleport you in France through amazing taste and aroma.I also dare to advise this place for those who want to make a romantic dinner. I'm sure the loved one will be pleasantly surprised.Best wishes!

Can't recommend this place enough!! We had the meat crepe and a couple iced coffees and it was perfect! The crepe was delicious and a good sized portion. We haven't even thought about it yet, but I'll bet we'll be back tomorrow based on how good it was today! Do yourself a favor and go!

I would have given them 5 starts for their superior, TrueType French pastries but their service is questionable.  I walked into the shop wearing my painting clothes.  Another woman walked in behind, with her exercise outfit.  The young cashier acknowledged me, and I walked over to the glass cases.  The cashier then acknowledged the other customer behind me and server her.  I stood and waited.  Then, after the cashier was finished, she did nothing l, just stood at the register.  I then asked twice if I could be served, to which she finally responded.  By the way, the cashier didn't apologize.

Cute little bakery. Had macaroons and a cappuccino here. Same price as chain coffee places but I'd rather come here for the aesthetic-- and theres a perfect spot by the window to people watch. Wasn't crowded at all.

We had the ham and cheese croissant and wanted a crepe too but we were too full!!!!  Croissant was flaky and buttery and the ham/cheese balance was just right.  We liked this so much that we went back but they closed at 6PM.  So sad...

Great macaroons! Also if you check in on yelp you get a free macaroon which are priced at $2. Could also be a nice spot to study or get work done during the day since they have a decent amount of seating.

We came in 10 minutes before the bakery closed looking for a pastry to buy to eat the next morning. The guy behind the counter was rude and condescending when we asked him to help describe the remaining pastries left. He was rushing us and didn't seem to care about customer service. We bought 3 things and then left. The guy rushed to the door and locked it (closing 5 minutes early) as soon as we left. Terrible service, atmosphere, and overall experience!!

Super welcoming and helpful staff! Stunning pastries. We most enjoyed the raspberry and chocolate hazelnut spread filled beignets, and, the star of the day, the croque monsieur. Spongy bread with crisp crust lavished with toasted gruyere, salty ham, and addictively nutmeg-rich bechamel. I could eat this sandwich every day.
Everything is yummy and the people are really nice. What more can you ask for? Fresh bread, flaky croissants, and more! I might move into this neighborhood just to eat here every day.
Love this coffee shop. I used to go to the Lincoln park location all the time. Their pastry items are made in house and out of this world. They make bread for many local resturants in the area.

Very nice French bakery and cafe in Old Town. Great interior that feels very country French with wooden floors and tables. The veggie quiche was nice. I really liked the tuna salad sandwich. The multi-grain sourdough bread was very good. Nice croissant. Close to the el stops.

The cafe is comfy and inviting, and the quality of the baked goods here is really top notch. I might have just eaten an entire package of chocolate spritz cookies in a single sitting.... Really delicious, to-die-for croissants. So flaky, buttery, and just sheer perfection. Already plotting when I can return to buy more.My only quibble is they seem to use quite a bit of plastic packaging. La Fournette has lovely packaging design (i.e., logo) and of course the clear plastic allows potential customers to easily see the product within. I get that. But I would really prefer that these items were, well, biodegradable for obvious reasons. On a more superficial note, all the plastic detracts from the classic French bakery vibe. So: La Fournette, I am one customer in love with your tasty breads and pastries, and I hope you strongly consider switching to biodegradable packaging in the near term!

I live in Old Town and i'm glad to visit this place every day. Very friendly staff, great prices and AMAZING almond croissants. Also recommend to try baguette and coconut cookies.Guy from Ohio is very good, he provides the best customer service i've ever had.
My favorite bakery in Chicago! Thank you for the best croissants in the world!Amazing and very friendly staff! Thank you for the great service!

Coffee is good, pastries tasty but unfortunately their employees are rude and disrespectful to customers.  It was only I spent $30 in coffee that dude told me they're closing in 15 minutes and I needed to leave soon5 minutes after closing he came by and told us in rude tone 'we have been closed for 5 minutes you need to leave'.  Really? I'll leave to never come back!

This place makes me happy just walking through the door. Their breads and baguettes are amazing. They even won the "best baguette in Chicago" award. They also have really good coffee, sandwiches, quiches, crapes and many other baked goods. During holidays they make specialty cakes, like the chocolate log cake, which of I have to get two of since all of my family loves it. The stuff is always super nice, the place is cozy, and they have outdoor seating when it's warm. It's worth a visit.
How can you go wrong with carbs and coffee? Great service, cozy atmosphere, and delicious bakery items, sandwiches, quiches, and macaroons.

Their crepes are amazing and the iced coffee is delicious. I'm not sure why but it's better here than other places that serve the same brand. Also staff is wonderful and nice. I wish they had a vegetarian sandwich, but I survive with the vegetarian crepe :)

Cute french bakery with friendly french staff. This is the kind of cafe that reminds you of sunshine:)Def try their croissants: they are buttery on the inside and flaky on the outside. If you like sweets, try the almond croissant: powder sugar with sliced almond on the outside and almond cream on the inside. Nom!Raisin roulade is a good alternative to croissant too: its made with croissant dough, but the pastry cream made it sweet. I'm not a huge fan of raisins though. Love their crepe too!! Even the plain butter and sugar one tastes super good! Will def come back to try their bread and sandwiches.
Absolute must go to place for baguette in the French community. Never disappoints. Neighborhood discount available.

A lot of people think The Publican has the best bread. It's great but I think La Fournette is a shade better.  Their pastries are excellent.  Order some espresso get a croissant and close your eyes. You could be in France

My favorite place in Old Town. Family-run, authentic French bakery with the most friendly staff and the best almond croissant I've ever had. Good place for a light lunch as well: quiche, croque madame, and tarte flambée are all on the menu
prev_text: My favorite place in Old Town. Family-run, authentic French bakery with the most friendly staff and the best almond croissant I've ever had. Good place for a light lunch as well: quiche, croque madame, and tarte flambée are all on the menu.

Text: What can I say delicious!! the best baguette in the city, that I know of and I love baguettes.

We were really disappointed. We wanted to stop for a coffee and pastry pick-me-up. We yelped this place ahead of time and thought it was worth going slightly out of our way.The pastries in the display case looked beautiful. I got a beignet and my boyfriend got a brioche with streusel ($10.63 for the snacks and two small coffees, reasonable). They were not great. They tasted like yesterday's leftovers. I think that they probably could have been good if they'd been refreshed even in a toaster oven (or, ideally, baked the same day). Either that or they were just truly over done.After paying to park at a $4/hr meter we were not happy.We went across the street to get a croissant for comparison at Le Pain Quotidien and that was considerably better, which was disappointing because LPQ is a chain.The coffee (Intelligentsia) was very good, at least. La Fournette wasn't the worst but we were annoyed.

Get the bread! In fact, get two so you can snack on one and save one for later. Got the Olive Fougasse Bread and it was dynamite.Macarons all look fabulous. 1 free macaron for first Yelp check-in! Salted caramel was my choice and boy was it a good one. Just the right amount of sweet/savory flavor and consistency.Unfortunately the breakfast crepe missed the mark for me. It was overly loaded with diced up ham and bacon. Kudos for packing it all in, but it was overkill for me. Crepe was cooked nicely and paired with cheese and peppers. I picked it apart and ate it, but would go with a tartine next time.Beautiful looking pastries. I wanted one of everything!

Visiting Chicago for the weekend and found this cute spot to duck in and grab a little snack. Service is friendly and their trays are super cute! I think it would be a nice spot to grab a drink and a dessert, but not sure about having a full meal here.I ordered a quiche and a macaron.  The macaron was pretty delicious (mango flavored) and was not too sweet or too soft.  The quiche was a little less than what I was expecting. The flavor was good, but the crust needed help.  It was a little too thin and didn't support the filling. I suspect that it sitting out and being reheated doesn't help. I really wanted to love this place, as the atmosphere is cozy, but I couldn't.  Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing?

Coffee and chocolate are fantastic! Pastries are wonderful. Macarons are great, and if you check in from this place for the 1st Time you get one for free ;)Don't forget to buy some madeleines for home.

This place is a gem. I was walking through old town and just had to go in when I saw this adorable shop.  I love the chalk board menu and beautiful display of desserts and breads. I decided to order a couple of macaroons since I've never tried them before - I got the pistachio and earl grey ones, they were amazing!!
Dynamic bread.... their sour dough is to die for...Coffee is fantastic. Cappuccino is wonderful...Pastries are great

These are your perfectly average set of macarons, but far from outstanding. The first three macarons were decent in texture, however the last two of the macarons were missing that fluffy, airy, and lightly crisp exterior, weightless interior/softly smooth luxuriousness I crave, resulting in an sticky, overly-chewy sensation in each bite. Flavor wise, I did enjoy the Nutella and caramel macarons, it is accurate in one-dimensional flavor description, however it was not addicting nor something to rave about compared my favorites Laduree or Lolly & Pops. An easy pass for me, I am left despondent as I think this cafe has potential. I hope they will continue to improve and expand their flavor collection.

In the mood for a great Croque Monsieur?  If so, La Fournette is the place to go. We visited during a walking food tour, and it was easily my favorite stop.  The authentic French cafe vibe is present from the moment you enter.  There's an impressive selection of soups, sandwiches and pastries to meet everyone's needs. The breads are the highlight.Chef Pierre Zimmerman has put together something truly special. Check it out!

This place was pretty great. The food and coffee were excellent, and the macarons were my favorite. The menu had a lot of selection and there were a lot of pastries to choose from. We sat on the outside patio, which is beautiful on a nice day. The only downside was standing to wait for our meal to be ready for about 15 minutes, partly because they had to brew a new pot of coffee and it seemed to take forever. The restaurant setup requires you to stand while waiting and then bring your food out to your table, and this can be difficult when you have to carry your tray through the door and down the steps outside. I think it would make more sense to have table numbers and a table runner system instead.
An unexpected French oasis in old town Chicago. We went for breakfast before flying out after a wedding, and ended up picking up lunch to go as well.

I've been dying to come to this cafe for weeks now but I just haven't had a chance. I was on my way to the Yelp Elite Cocktail Competition and while I waited for my friend to pick me up, I stopped by here. Oh my goodness- I thought I had seen the best cafes in Chicago- I was wrong! This beautiful French cafe is absolutely beautiful from the outside and in. I arrived really late, around 6:24 and they close at 6:30 so I was relieved to see that they are not the type of place to close extra early just because they may not have as many customers. I literally squealed from joy when I walked in and told the employees I had rushed here from water tower to try their delicious macaroons! I had two- the chocolate and lychee. I also spied a raspberry beignet. When you check in, you get a free macaroon so for the two macaroons and French beignet, the total was $5.56? Pretty good deal if you ask me. I was blown away by the ambiance, everything is wooden and cute. My only regret is that I didn't get a chance to stay longer and explore. I ate the raspberry beignet on my way out- I've made beignets before and they are best straight out of the oven so I wasn't completely disappointed when they had lost some of their freshness by 6:30 at night- they had probably been out for almost twelve hours anyways. The raspberry jam was very delicious, it tasted very organic and the dough of the beignet was not thick. It was cooked perfectly and the dough did not overpower the filling! I would HIGHLY recommend coming here for Saturday morning coffee or mid afternoon break! From all my excitement, forgot to take a photo

MACAROONS HEAVEN!!! Omg selection galore! Incredible service! The selection and service at this bakery is outstanding! The coffee is fresh and delicious! Adorable  cafe! Large seating area good for groups! Macaroons have great texture to them!
Absolutely am in love with this place, their earl grey tea macaron is delicious. Will always be my go to.

It's a little pricey and the food is alright. The service has always been very hospitable. We went there after we got home from Paris and went back again after the French election.It's a great place to meet a friend for coffee and a sweet treat if you're already in the neighborhood. I wouldn't recommend it for anything else. It always leaves me wanting more.
The most amazing vegetarian quiche, and ham and cheese brioche sandwiches.  Founding baker won the World Cup of baking in 1994.  Can't miss this place.

If you like authentic French, you will like this. I am overweight so I have a rule that I can only eat a desert that I have never had before. If I say no deserts it would be a burning desire that I carried with me. I cannot pass a new bakery. I went in here and found one of those magic deserts. They have one called "Uncle Hansi" cake. It is a their family only recipe. It is an Alsatian hazelnut-almond pound cake. I spoke to the brothers that own the bakery. They are French and they bake all of the traditional French pastries. I was full so could not try the croissant but they assured me that it is right. I am excited for the next time. They also serve food but I will get to that next time.

Tres Bien!So there are these cookies I brought home from Paris, they were so good that I didn't give away my last box like I had planned. (So they got chocolate instead).  When I visited La Fournette, I asked them if they made cookies and the friendly folks said that they really focus on pastries. But as I described the cookie, with a nod to each other, they said I must try their Vanilla Spritz cookie.  I think there was an extra spring in my step that day because even though they looked totally different from my Paris cookies, they had the same great buttery, mildly sweet taste.  The croissant was also divine. Buttery, flaky and perfectly made. Not my favorite in the city, but definitely a close second.  My son and I also sat in for lunch the same week and we shared the Quiche and Croque Monsieur.  We both decided the quiche was just ok--it was weirdly crumbly, but tasted good. The Croque was delicious and wonderfully cheesy. The space is very homey, reminiscent of France. I overheard who I assume is the owner speaking in rapid French over the phone. Too bad I'm not in the area often; this would be my go-to boulangerie for sure.

Looking at the pictures on Yelp made the pastries look so good.I got a few macarons and a couple beignets as well as a latte.  The macarons were good- matcha, mango passion fruit, coconut and one other flavor I can't remember.  The beignets were not light and fluffy like the ones you'd get in New Orleans.  These were dense and chewy.The latte was pretty bad.  The milk was steamed improperly so I basically had a cup full of foam and a little bit of super hot milk.  Service was great but it can't make up for the disappointing pastry & latte.

Lovely French family owns this gem...warm greeting when you arrive, Bon jour I've tried the almond croissant, homemade quiches, homemade granola, soups, all are heavenly. That being said, soup is a bit pricy. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. Dine in or during nice weather sit outside and watch the world go by. They provide pastries for some very high end restaurants like the Peninsula, so we are lucky to have them in our hood. Merci

Yummy is all I can say. My favorite old town bakery.  Try the delicious croissants and Home made soup. I can be a coffee snob (not a Starbucks fan). The coffee here is very good. A great way to start your day.

Update:  UGH. Looking at my previous review, I don't know why I came back here AND ordered another sandwich. I wanted to give them a second chance because their baguettes really are good.  When I arrived, in their case were a few of each variety of sandwich.  I asked what condiments were on the ham and cheese and they replied mustard.  I asked for a fresh sandwich because I cannot stand mustard.  They told me that they could not make me a fresh sandwich and continued by singing the praises of their sandwiches, saying that the mustard is really light, and you can barely taste it at all, and one of them just had one last night and couldn't even tell, blah blah blah.  Bottom line, they refused to make me a fresh sandwich.  I got the ham and cheese, and the mustard was the only thing I tasted.  I ended up ripping out the inside layer of baguette because the taste was overpowering - kind of like when you tell someone who doesn't like fish not to worry because it doesn't taste fishy...if you don't like something, it's the ONLY thing you can taste, am I right?For a $9 sandwich, ripping out the insides and leaving still hungry is unacceptable.The best part, however, is when I got up to leave, I saw that the display case contained at least 6 FRESH ham and cheese sandwiches! I had been willing to forgive the inability to make me a sandwich, thinking it might have been due to lack of ingredients, but NO...they were just unwilling.Stay away from La Fournette, they LIE!
prev_text: I've had their baguettes and they're amazing, so I came here for a late afternoon snack.  I had the turkey sandwich on a pretzel which was decent.  I was not expecting them to take it right from the display window and heat it up, I was expecting it to be made fresh, so I was a little leery about all the mayo slathered on it, but I'm still alive so far.  Good macarons, not the best I've had, but ok.  Intelligentsia coffee. I think I'll stick to just getting bread from them and get my meals elsewhere, though I'm glad I tried it!

Text: I decided to visit this place last Saturday as it was nearby the area I had to go to pick up my gear for the Color in Motion 5k run. First time being in a French bakery, there were so many options to choose from in terms of sweets-like macarons, danishes,  beignets(which honestly seems like a pricer version of Pączki!), sandwiches and breads. The server was very helpful in pointing out what macarons flavor was which! Prices seem reasonable for portion! Service was excellent! I enjoyed getting a box of 12 assorted macarons, apricot danish, and raspberry and hazelnut beignets! I would go back here but may skip on the beignets and try the sandwiches and other macarons flavors.

The baguette with butter and homemade preserves is so so delicious! Staff is extremely warm and friendly and the ambiance is inviting. Shoutout to Victoria for helping me pick the perfect snack to hit the spot!

Found this place today morning on our way to our bike ride along the Lake shore trail. Had not been in Old Town in years. The ham and cheese Croissant made the day. Flaky enough and so flavorful. The place feels like a spot in Northern France. Coffee was just right. Loved the down to earth feel and genuinely good service. Will come back even if it is a bit of a drive.

I love La Fournette's food. I used to go to the one on Clark street all the time until they sadly closed down, but I just moved to Old Town so I'm so excited to be back in La Fournette land!  My absolute favorite dish is the quiche, I love love quiche and La Fournette's is probably some of the best I've had.  Really buttery and the crust is flaky.  The macarons are also really good, they have good flavors and they are like the best dessert ever.  I like their Niçoise salad as well and the dressing is yummy. I've got to knock off a star for service.  It's not that the service is slow, it's just like, so blah.  Every time I walk in here (both locations), I feel like the people behind the counter look at me like I'm from another planet and they don't know what a human is.  Straight deer in headlights look! No "hey!! Welcome to La Fournette! What can I get you???". Like zero excitement or even acknowledgment that I just walked into their place of business and would like to order something.  Overall La Fournette is a great little cafe, the owner is usually around too which is great. Don't be phased by the weird service, the food is great.

I live more north of this location and really miss having a La Fournette right on Clark! I love this place's quiche, baked goods, and of course their macarons, which are cheaper than other French patisseries in the area. Service & atmosphere: the place has counter service and the staff yesterday were very friendly, warm, and informative. The place has a French countryside rustic vibe, and we sat outside in the small patio, which was perfect for the one of 5 sunny days this spring. Food: Between three people, we shared coffee and chocolate madeleines, a chicken and spinach quiche, a nicoise salad, and an almond croissant. I got a free espresso macaron with Yelp check-in, it was so delicious and perfectly baked, and I obviously wasn't going to share it with anyone. The madeleines were dense and fluffy, and the chocolate ones were especially flavorful. The nicoise salad was fine, but the quiche was creamy and had a buttery flaky crust. The almond croissant was the BEST I've ever had. Crispy, flakiness on the outside with soft, light insides and a generous amount of sweet almond paste. It was so good that I will absolutely be back just for macarons and croissant the next time I'm in need of French baked goods.

Not sure why this place has so many great reviews. Perhaps because it was part of some French tour. Nothing French about this place other than the employees' cold attitude.We ordered a piece of quiche, a savory crepe and a macaron. Quiche was not memorable. Crepe was really bad. The whole thing, from skin to filling all actually tasted rubbery. Raspberry macaron was very dense and super sweet. I didn't taste any raspberry. Price was over the top for strange tasting, luke warm food. We will not be back.

Great French bakery ! Wonderful tasty pastry and good sandwiches. Top it up with a good latte to start the day!  Definitely recommend! Michelle and Luke who runs this place are very polite , helpful and fun to talk to.
C'est delicieux! The Croque Monseieur melts in your mouth, the quiche is superb, and the Macarons... Oh lord.  This French bakery has a lot of heart and you can tell they put it into their flavors!

FYI. Food is good but every weekend that have group tours there so if you're looking to sit down there to dine or work, you're essentially hearing a lady shout facts and a group conversing, it gets kind of loud and annoying. It's the Sat and Sun and seems like an all day thing.
I can't stop buying croissant when I walk though this street. Their croissant is real French taste. It's better than one I had one of a lot in Paris.

Cute little place in Old Town! My husband ordered the meat crepe and I ordered the veggie crepe with coffees. The crepes were absolutely fantastic as well as the coffee. The crepes were made with good quality ingredients, which made for quite the tasty breakfast. Will definitely be going back to try more items on the menu!

This place has awesome French macarons and when you check in on Yelp, you get a free one, how awesome is that? Parking is damn near impossible and I came here mid-morning on a Thursday. The staff is very friendly and the place smells amazing.

Very pricey and not that great. Went in because it had great reviews on yelp but don't know who is really reviewing this I don't think it was good it looked and tasted like something I could get at at any other cafe. It didn't have many displays I walked up and down it and didn't see anything appetizing so just ordered on a whim and wasn't satisfied w my crepe.

Love this place. French cuisine in perfection. Feel like im in Paris. Michelle helped me to placed an order for my bridal shower, of course, first thing that came to my mind are the macaroons. Michelle was very helpful and genuine with her service. Will also recommend their Quiche Lorraine. Never had one like theirs. I must say a really "Authentic French Bakery." Merci Michelle.

I'm a sucker for almond croissants and macarons, so whenever I'm traveling, they're always on my hitlist. La Fournette had a good selection and prices were reasonable, but their baked goods just didn't have that x-factor. The shop is cute though, and the surrounding area is very walkable, so it could be worth checking out if you are already in the area.

This is how a bakery should smell - like butter. Not sugar.  I explained to the lovely lady behind the counter that I would have one of everything, and she laughed.  I was only half kidding, but reason took over and I settled on a bowl of mushroom soup and a tarte flambée baguette.I was unimpressed with the soup, which was missing that rich mushroom flavor and brothiness of a good mushroom soup.  Though to be fair I sort of make the best mushroom soup myself (combined from a recipe from America's Test Kitchen, a Japanese cooking show, many trips to farmer's markets and Mitsuwa, and a great deal of trial and error) so maybe it was unfair of me to hold those same standards to this cute little bakery that bakes first and probably sells soup as an afterthought.  The tarte flambée was phenomenal - just fantastic, and was the one of the best things I ate all week.  The macaron I had afterwards was pretty great too - not too sweet.This s my kind of bakery, and I'll definitely be back.

La Fournette is such a hidden gem on Wells. I pass by this place all the time and only recently decided to stop in with my mom. The staff is so friendly and they speak French. There are so many authentic food items and breads to order. I had the croque monsieur and mushroom soup. The croque was better than ones I have had in Paris. Hard to believe, I know. The mushroom soup was amazing as well. The soups are different everyday I assume but if you catch the mushroom soup, definite get it.My mom had quiche lorraine (with bacon) and it was so light and the crust was flaky. The portion is very generous and the bacon isn't too salty.We got some macarons to go because we were both stuffed after eating our mains. I ordered a pistachio macaron and ate it 3 minutes after we left. The macaron was so light and subtly sweet. A great end to the meal.I love this place and will be coming back.

Super disappointed in this place. First so much for "authentic" French bakery- all their sandwiches are premade, they "could not" make one with out cheese. The quinoa salad was decent. My boyfriend ordered a turkey panini and they brought him the ham one instead. It wasn't busy. We were the only people in the place besides one other person. I have no idea how this place has such good reviews

Wonderful French bakery! The fare is authentic and the staff is delightful. I had a vegetable quiche and cappuccino. Both were fantastic! I also got a baguette and Madeline cookies to go. Everything was fresh and delicious. I'm so happy I found this gem! Highly recommend!

Lovely authentic french bakery. This is one of those spots where it's hard to pick out one item from behind the glass. Every time I walk into La Fournette I'm split between which croissant to choose. Naturally, I talk myself into getting two :) a chocolate and an almond. I also highly recommend the beignets. The best I've ever had.The only thing keeping La Fournette from 5 stars is the amount of seating. Quiet and relaxing space, but I've never been able to sit down. Perfect to-go option though!

Great bakery tried a few things: hazelnut sprintz cookies, chocolate muffins and macaroons! Each thing was very fresh and stayed well the next day too. They had stopped making crepes for the day when we went, but will be back again to try those!

My wife and I stopped in here on a whim our first week in Chicago and we fell in love! We were greeted by the wonderful staff and they helped us pick out some great authentic French food. The environment is charming and vintage and we felt like we were in a French cafe (even though neither of us have been to France). Highly recommended!

Okay, maybe I missed something but it was not good at all.  (Maybe I was there on a off Day?I ordered ham cheese and the sauscion sandwich, French onion and hazelnut donut for $30!! Expensive even for old town. First, the bread was hard as a rock I get crusty French bread but this was day old bread it hurt the roof of my mouth chewing it and 5 meager slices of salami on a $10 sandwich pathetic.  Ham and cheese was a little better but same day old bread I could pound on the table, with the ingredients again paltry. The soup was the only thing that was OK.  Now the French donut (Benet (sp)) was so dry I had to use water to choke it down.  Seriously, I'm not a picky eater but the Einstein bagels next door has better sandwiches. I was really misled with all the great reviews which is rare on here. Maybe no one has been to France around the neighborhood but no where near the fine dining and casual food they are known for. Also, will say staff was nice so that's a plus. This review was solely on my food experience.

Very cute family run French bakery.  Might not be fancy compare to other French bakeries in Chicago but I love this place better than the other places. Staff is very friendly.  I am a regular for their signature Miche bread. Highly recommend their cookies - very European.  Soup and sandwiches are delicious.

What a gem! The smell is exhilarating. The pastries are delicious and diverse.  What s cool neighborhood. We had never been to Old Town.  If you are going to visit Chicago take the brisk walk to get here and reward yourself with a treat.
You cannot go wrong with their breads or bagels.  Outstanding breads. Solid coffee and very nice service.I love their pave.

OK - If I am in the neighborhood, I come here.  If I was closer, I would be stopping for macaroons more often.  The pumpkin flavor was amazing...well, I haven't found one that I didn't like :) The earl gray is surprisingly tasty.  I missed the straight raspberry but that just means I need to come back by during the summer.  The cost is high by grocery store standards but the taste makes it seem like you are purchasing a hand-crafted creation instead of just a cookie.
Excellent, fresh products. One of the friendliest staffs that I've ever seen in Chicago

The hazelnut crepe and breakfast sandwich were good.  I was expecting the treats to be as good.  However, I think the macarons were old or made incorrectly.  They were too hard.  I got 6 and got 1 that was actually the right texture.  I was very disappointed.
This place exceeds expectations. We had the potato leek soup and Tarte Flambé Bagette  my daughter had the Brie panini both were outstanding. What a find. Highly recommended for lunch.
Their ham panini is amazing. So happy I stumbled across this place. Very friendly staff too. I will keep coming back!
Way overpriced. Spent $49 on 4 sandwiches and 6 macarons. The only sandwich that was tasty was the panini. The rest were way too bready and barely any meat. Very good service, fwiw.
Friendly staff from Alsace. Amazing soups and pastries. Wish I had something like this in my neighborhood. Would enthusiastically return.
Truly wonderful. Best almond croissant ever wow!! Feels like Europe. Go here.

I think their forte is pastries and not sandwiches/lunch items. Had a perfect almond croissant - it was delicious and fresh. Ordered the Brie panini and it was just okay. My husband ordered the meat crepe and the crepe itself tasted perfect but wasn't sure about the inside - just didn't taste amazing. Stick to coffee and pastries

One of the best bakeries in the city!  They serve Intelligentsia coffee which is great!  For the baked goods, the croissants and breads are amazing.  It truly feels like taking a quick trip to France when eating at La Fournette!

This place is Amazing!! This was my first time coming here. It felt like I was back in Europe being in this place. The staff all seemed to have an accent which I loved and has inspired me to take French. I had to take my order to go the first time but I have eaten here again since. I had the Veggie and chicken and spinach Quiche, beignets, chocolate croissant,  and tabouli and quinoa salad. Every single item was amazing. Since then, I returned and had the savory omelet, crapes, more beignets, coffee and tea, and some macaroons... All terrific. They even give you a free macaroon on your first visit when you check-in on Yelp. Overall an amazing experience!! Not 5-stars because when it is packed...which is usually the case...the space is limited and it can get a little claustrophobic. There is a patio but too warm that day...plan on using it in the future on a cooler morning.
Great croissants, macaroons, and baguettes.  Their croissants and baguettes are world class!Mariano's in west loop has their croissants and baguettes in stock at the bakery.
prev_text: Great french bakery that I will be back to.  The almond croissant was one of the best I ever had.  Will need to try the chocolate one next time.Wife seemed to like the hazelnut beignet a lot, but I thought it would be better if freshly out of the fryer.  Their macaroons seemed very legit and authentic as well from the one I tried.

Text: We stopped in for a quick lunch. The menu is simple, classic french sandwiches & soup along with very yummy tasty treats! The best almond croissant I have every had, no joke. My Croque-monsieur was fantastic. Felt like I was in Paris again. The atmosphere is very basic and simple. Service was polite and efficient. The food is the star at La Fournette.

Love this place. Wish they have this in DFW. I used to frequent La Fournette back when I was still in Chicago and still try to go whenever I'm in town. It's a French style bakery that offers delicious baked goods. I love their croissants, macarons and coffee/espresso.

Great spot for a pastry and coffee in the morning. La Fournette is a French style bakery offering breads, croissants, etc and also some lunch options (sandwiches, quiche, etc).Came by for breakfast and tried a streusel brioche and a danish. Also had to get the free macaron with Yelp check-in! Both breakfast bread options were good as well as the coffee. Between streusel brioche and the danish, I would get the danish again as it was lighter and had more flavor. The Linzer macaron shell was a little bit too crunchy (seemed like it may have been borderline stale) but the filling was their excellent jam which I now want to buy a jar of!Will definitely be back for a fast casual breakfast. Also love that they serve your selections on cute chalkboards or in break baskets for the table, very nice presentation while eating in.

one of the best bakeries we had in chicago, really loved the croissants here! the macaroons are pretty good too, not too sweet. if you check in for the first time, they would even offer a free macaroon for you

La Fournette in Old Town is a wonderful place to go. It is a French café where you can get excellent Intelligentsia coffee, tea, bakery goods, and tasty french menu items. The menu is small but everything tastes great, you know what is said, "Everything tastes better with butter." In addition they serve the best bread in Old Town, even the croutons are "magnifique!"  it goes great with La Fournette's hearty soups or salads. Make sure that you do not forget to purchase some of the bakery goods to take home, they have the best macaroons in the city, along with wonderful croissants and beignets. Customers, order at the counter and all orders are brought to the table by a cheerful server.I recommend La Fournette to everyone and give it 5 stars.
This is a wonderful place for just about anything they serve. The macarons and croissants are so good. Almost as good as Buchon.
The best, officially absolutely the best croissants in the city. As perfect as in Parisian La Grande Epicerie de Paris. Took me a year of trials to find a perfect ones! On macaroons - very good too!
prev_text: The best, officially absolutely the best croissants in the city. As perfect as in Parisian La Grande Epicerie de Paris. Took me a year of trials to find a perfect ones! On macaroons - very good about 4 stars but not the best in the city. I think I might just gotten not the freshest ...I will give it another try next times!Update: macaroons are perfect! It was just that one , a lemon flavored off a spec;)

Text: Went there hungry on a weekday 2pm.  The place was quiet, clean and relaxing. Had the Bretzel turkey sandwich, gumbo soup, plain beignet, plain croissant and tuna salad. Although nothing spectacular, I thought everything was done thoughtfully alright.  I wish I was there earlier in the day when the rolls/pastries won't be dry and will be fresh out of the oven/kitchen.  The Espresso macaron was good - chewy and the right sweetness. The service was helpful and attentive.  I would come back again in the future.

For our wedding favors, we wanted to give our guests a pair of macarons in a square box with a ribbon and thank you sticker on the box. We went to several bakeries/pastry shops in Chicago to taste test macarons and ask if they offer boxing, bulk pricing, and delivery to our venue. La fournette provided everything; they gave us the best price, impeccable gift wrapping, and had the BEST tasting Macarons! The staff was so friendly and willing to work with all of our requests. I will be coming back here many times in the future to try all of their pastries and food!
Although they have an impressive array of baked goods, I would not recommend this place.  I ate lunch here today and thought it was pretentious, expensive and mediocre.

If you're someone who love cheese like me, you should get the ham and cheese croque Monsieur ! You won't regret it at all ! This is deliciously cheesy and moist ! I really love it and I am planning to come back for my cheese cravings! I also ordered a cup of mocha .. I am a person that like more bitter than sweet so I think the mocha is done just right :) I think this bakery is super cute , should definitely bring a book and spend sometime just getting work done or reading here. One bad thing that they don have outlets inside ... So you can't charge anything. But overall I love it.

I think a beignet shouldn't taste or look like a doughnut and they should be made to order. I was really disappointed because what I bought was a doughnut, not a beignet.  And the chocolate croissant I got wasn't flaky on the outside or soft on the inside.  I had high hopes for this place because the reviews were so good, but sadly I just wasted money.

Baked goods seem pretty good, but they offer a lot of other stuff that is pretty mediocre.The meat breakfast crepe was a joke.  It was all watery, with very low quality ingredients.The mocha was also pretty lackluster, kind of burnt and bland.I would stick to the baked goods and macarons here.

I have been dreaming of a sandwich from here since I started working in the neighborhood 2 months ago, but I was Very Disappointed with my purchase today.I arrived at La Fournette around 1pm today and ordered the Saucisson Sandwich: Dry-cured salami on freshly baked baguette. After I placed my order, the guy behind the counter produced my sandwich in record speed, and when I commented on this, he said the sandwiches were pre made. I was suprised and wondered to myself how long the sandwiches sat there before they are bought. I took my sandwich to go, and I should have looked at it before hand, because when I got home, my heart sank.The sandwich came with mustard, hazelnuts, and micro-greens, and to my dismay, the portion itself was Micro-sized. The flavors of the salami, mustard, and hazelnuts were lost in the oversized bread- but I did enjoy the baguette.This was the lightest, thinnest sandwich I have ever had! For $9.95, I feel really let down and couldn't even finish the second half of the sandwich, I was so sad.The top-rated stars and reviews lured me in, but the build of my sandwich disappointed and saddened me.

I love this twist of the macaron. As if macarons weren't already amazing, filling the center with gelato is genius and delicious. I wish there was a cafe in my hometown that sold these decadent treats  (I would probably be there every day).The cafe had plenty of seating and the guy working the counter was incredibly sweet and patient. I loved what I ordered even though I was totally skeptical because they didn't look that good in the case because they are cold they break easily. I will definitely be back during my next trip.

Killer almond croissants. Hazelnut beignet was crispy outside and tender inside, although the hazelnut filling wasn't quite hazel-nutty enough for my taste. Rich, delicious coffee and macarons as tasty as they are attractive more than made up for that. Plus the proprietors are friendly and helpful and the shop is cute and clean. If I lived nearby I would eat breakfast here every week.

I'm so happy that I found this store.  I am a big fan of Italian macarons.  I've tried to make it by my own, but it's not the same. A great choice here, really good taste. And friendly atmosphere which is very important for me. Keep it up. Thanks.

Came in for my good friends birthday and fell in love!! It's like being in France. The workers were super welcoming and the macaroons were so addicting that I ended up buying an entire two boxes. Plus if you Yelp them they give you a deal! Their hot chocolate is the most flavorful I've ever had

First stop on a Divvy bike tour of the city...I had Crêpe "Suzette" and a cappuccino.....Fantastic!!!! I had a lot of questions in regards to the sweet treats and my server was very patient and helpful....loved how cheerful she was...i'll definitely be retuning....so happy I found this gem!
Decent spot, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. The panini I ordered was burnt. I love macarons, but the macarons here are just okay. And the internet goes in and out.
A delightfully friendly little French bakery!  Being from Minnesota, I did not know that macarons 1) do not have coconut in them & 2) aren't spelled macaroons. I gotta get out more often.

As close to Paris in Chicago you can get. You are greeted with warm 'Bonjour' and the scent of the newly baked croissants. I get any and every type of quiche they cook - lorraine, chicken, asaparagus, any. I love my little seat at the window to delve into my Parisian breakfast, always consisting of quiche, croissant, and coffee. It's truly one of those moments, you are brought to another place in your mind- even for just a moment, just a breakfast. NOTE: They do cater. I recommended to a girlfriend she order a quiche for a brunch at her house.... it is always delicious.
Best authentic French bakery in the downtown area!Awesome bread! Awesome pastry! Amazing macaron! Everything is perfect!

It's so hard to find macaroons in Chicago, let alone good ones. Thank you fellow yelpers. First, let me start off by saying macaroons are my favourite cookie. Like I love love love macaroons. Every time I go to a place that sells macaroons, I absolutely have to buy some. I've tried Argo's macaroons, ones from the French market, and Mariano's, etc. It's really hard to find that perfect macaroon with the crunchy shell on the outside and the chewy centre.I was in desperate need to settle my macaroon craving and not with some average ones. Drove all the way from Bridgeport to check out this little joint. Was worth the trip. Their macaroons are the best. I bought three boxes. Saving some for tomorrow. (': I love how flavourful they are and they are the absolute perfect consistency.

This little café is an absolute gem. The chocolate croissants and their large cappuccinos are delicious!!! Don't forget to try their Cassie macaroons. My favorite part? The people that work here are very kind.

The most fantastic, authentic French cafe in Chicago. Delicious pastries and coffee/orange juice. I especially liked the Three Cheese Panini (which has Comte cheese in it!). Very friendly staff. Make sure to bring cash for tip.

If you're in Old Town Chicago, You have to stop by for The B E S T Cappuccino and the greatest homemade desert. (Cookies and cakes).They also make delicious crunchy Sandwiches.The only thing I didn't really like was the filling for their hazelnut Crapes..
Tasty pastries, good soup.  Only 4 stars because the coffee is disappointing in quality.

4 stars for the bread, which looked very high quality. The macarons were not a good delicate texture and I suspect they were old. The pastries were decent, not worth seeking out. Again, the bread looked quite good and I didn't see any other bakeries with comparable bread.

One of the best cafes in town, My favorite item is the tuna sandwich, but everything about this cafe is amazing, from the great service, awesome friendly staff to the delicious and fresh food.If you want to surprise your partner with a box of tasty and beautiful macaroon box, La Founette is the place. Prices are affordable comparing to  competitors.It's a family business, you can see the owner at the cafe greeting and talking to customers. Finally if you want to feel Paris vibe you have to come and try this amazing cafe.
Love the coffee and the pastries! Wish one of these were closer to my apartment.
You should come get coffee and a pastry here over Einstein's Bagels next door for you can get Einstein's ANYWHERE!

La Fornette is a classic French bakery. What's not to like about that? I love places with classic style. This place has got it. It was relaxing and homey and I would have liked to have lingered for a time, eating pastry after pastry and sipping S Pellegrino while sleepily looking around at the beauty of this lovely cafe. But there was more to be done that day. This was the first stop on my Chicago coffee/food tour. I didn't get much because I was preparing my stomach for a lot more that day. Five assorted madeleines and the free macaron upon check-in. The madeleines were good, kind of like small muffins only in a different shape. Sadly the macaron, light rose, was dry and/or stale. I was expecting better from a place like this. My friend got three and some of them were a lot better, but surely they should all be perfect. And he said the ham and cheese croissant was Excellent. The people were friendly. The place was cool. Most of the food was good. It was an appropriate start to my day.

As some other posters commented, some of the macaroons were fresh and delicious (citron and cassis) and others you could tell had been sitting for days.  The caramel was literally rock hard.  Pistachio was half way there.  The service was good and friendly.

Very friendly service, fast, and food was fresh! I got the chocolate croissant and it was amazing, melted in my mouth. My friend got the croque monsieur and it was also very tasty. Iced coffee was good. Nice, cozy atmosphere--would definitely come back for coffee, snack, or meal. Prices were fair and the selection was good.The macarons were just okay--lacked some flavor.

The french bread and the chocolate croissant were so tasty, that melt in your mouth flakey chocolatey goodness is the stuff dreams are made of. I was a bit disappointed with the macaroons as the cookie part was too hard but the service was great and that croissant more than made up for it.

I came here after seeing that their yelp reviews were so great, unfortunately their macaroon werent!Pistachio is my favorite flavor and usually the only flavor I get. The pistachio macaroons here were brown, unlike other places, green. It didn't look as appealing, so I decided to try other flavors. Lucky I did because after purchase a dozen of macaroons.I tired the pistachio and it was stale! I thought that maybe they all just taste like that, so I tired another flavor and the others were fine, but not great like the ones I've tired at other places.The macaroon are cheaper here, and if you check in you get one for free. But what is the point if they aren't even good.
It was such a pleasant experience. Got to enjoy some delicious macaroons with peppermint tea.Note: Check in to get a free macaroon!

I've never tried their baked goods, which are probably excellent based on reviews, but I never will now. Last night after work I was almost run down by their truck. They should be more careful about who they let drive their vans.
If u are looking for lousy service ... cold mocha coffee ... and pretentious french accents this is the place. I now understand why so many Americans dislike the french.

I'm a macaroon girl 'cause I'm fancy. Pinky up when you eat one. Always pinky up.I work from home on Fridays and after some hours spent at the Starbucks nearby, the tummy started rumbling. Right down the street is this lovely bakery filled with very friendly staff. It's not overly complicated, not overly French, and perfectly delicious. I had myself a melty Turkey Panini. It didn't last long on that plate. To finish it off, a Hazelnut and a Raspberry macaroon. Raspberry was the winner.They don't have sodas so I had to try my best to not pronounce too many R's when ordering a "Perrier".I'll definitely be back.

This place is quiet but cute. Decided to stop by before starting our busy day. The waitress was really nice and the food is tasty. But my favorite is their plain coffee, it's not burned or watery like most cafes.
Wonderful delightful people working there,  fabulous breads and pastries,  delicious coffee and a cozy Euro patisserie ambiance.  We need one in every neighborhood.
I very much enjoy the coffee and croissants here.  I would make it a regular habit, except I find the prices inflated. Probably for the best, to keep my figure and diet in check.
Great crepes, I'd highly recommend them and the earl gray macaroons they have are an unusual but delicious flavor. The service is good too.
For pastries, beignets, croissants, and macaroons this place won't disappoint! Savory crepes are a favorite. They also have wonderful fresh breads and classic French sandwiches like Ham and cheese.

La Fournette has wonderful products.  I have not been into the bakery, but when we get catered breakfasts, the pastries always include their fantastic croissants (plain, chocolate, almond).  Their danish are really wonderful too.  I am looking forward to getting to their brick and mortar locations to try all of the foods they offer!

Excellent service and delicious macaroons! Be sure to make use of the free macaroon through the yelp check in. The bakery smelled amazing and everyone loved what they ordered. My personal favorite was the raspberry macaroon, so yummy!

I had a cappuccino and a ham&cheese crepe. This place has a nice vibe and the French theme doesn't come off pretentious. However, it fails to live up to the expectations when it comes to food. While the crepe batter had a nice flavor, the stuffing was simply bad. There was maybe two teaspoons of cheese in that crepe and the ham was very salty. The employees seemed uninterested in helping the customers.
This place is amazing. They really give you an authentic French experience. The people are nice, the coffee is good, and the ambiance is excellent.

This place is the best for baguettes, croissants, macaroons.... Seriously, it's like you're in France. I love it! I go often and I'm never disappointed. The staff is sweet and it's a winner every time.

Good keesh (no idea how to spell, too lazy to google) and good doughnuts.  It's very european, which is only frustrating because the portions are small.  If you want breakfast, you'll end up buying 2 of everything just to get full.  My gf loves it and rightfully so, but I'm a 25 year old guy and I need more than their servings provide my appetite at 10am.

Really cute French bakery with great pastries and macaroons.  It's pleasant to be greeted by friendly employees saying "Bonjour!" There is a great selection in the morning, but it dwindles as the day goes on, so get there earlier for the best choices.  They also have free wifi!

Had the free macaron with yelp checkin - being from Montreal, was a bit disappointed - very sweet rather than savory, outside not crunchy enough. Had the baguette - OK i guess, rather subpar for someone expecting French quality baguette. However, we had a piece of rye bread (quoted as beibg their specialty, sold by weight) - very happy with it, would return for it if in the neighborhood! Great for sandwiches and a good deal too. Tried the croissant too - nice and buttery but lackinf the crunch/crust/crumbliness of french croissants...Overall, for bread snobs, a few good options, but will keep looking for the perfect baguette and coissant in Chicago.

I was very excited to have coffee here because I was from out of town and a friend said the coffee was amazing. The girl at the front was INCREDIBLY rude to me. I asked for a coffee then changed my mind to a cappuccino and she huffed and puffed, then proceeded to be rude throughout the entire transaction. I felt like I was a nuisance for ordering a coffee. Nothing against the pastries but the service should be reconsidered.

A cute lil French cafe in a cute lil neighborhood. I randomly came across it, and I'm glad I did. I got the savory crepe, and although it was a little over-priced, it was fantastic. If you check in here, you get a free macaron, and if you don't grab one (or four) you're missing out... they are amazing.

Delicious everything! We had the quiche and were very delighted! Also had a cappuccino which we really loved too.  They brew intelligentsia and they brew it well :)If you go later in the day you will have slim pickins as this place is quite popular and the favorites are definitely gone by the late afternoon.  Great service & quality and quick!   Check in on yelp to get a free macaron!

This place is a legit French bakery with a French owner from the D'Alsace region and it shows - the food is authentic and impressive. I'm a bit of a macaron snob, and their Lindor (If I recall the name correctly) flavor macaron was probably one of the best I've ever had (this includes ones from Paris). It's a chocolate hazelnut raspberry flavor with a perfectly crunchy outer layer and gooey sweet inside! Seriously take advantage of the free macaron with a yelp check in offer. We had the quinoa salad which was very flavorful and the veggie crepe which was incredible! It was filled with this fantastic French cheese I had never heard of but unlike anything I've ever tasted. Just as we were finishing the chocolate hazelnut cookies came out of the oven and filled the whole bakery with the most intoxicating smell so we couldn't leave without getting them. They have a handful of sandwiches and lunch items but their bread and pastries seem to be their real specialty. Staff was friendly, helpful and even wrote down the name of that delicious cheese for me! It has a casual cafe atmosphere that doesn't guilt you for lingering a while after your meal. I will be back!

This place. Ohhhhhhh. Amazing. Eat the beignets. Do it. Only your waistline may regret it. The hazelnut one was incredible!! So. So. Incredible. The Croque Monsieur was also wonderful, as were the macarons. Very friendly staff and a very cute place. Do yourself a favour. Dooooo itttttt.
Awesome and authentic French Food!! Amazing crepes (we tried veggie) and gazpacho - even macarons. Highly recommended.

Three girls walk into a bakery...and two of them have never had a macaroon before.Call me uncultured, but I had no idea what these things were other than super cute. And today I got to try them here, and they were great!The server was friendly, the place was really cute (minus the sticky tables) and the macaroons were great. I'll be back for them, but probably would shy away from their regular foods because of the prices.

La Fournette was a life saver for me while staying nearby. Thank god for WIFI! Iced lattes were fantastic. I wouldn't say this is the best coffee I've ever had, but this was fantastic nevertheless (La Fournette over Starbucks any day!). I would skip the almond croissant (they smear almond paste between the sliced croissant which is way too sweet for me!) and go for the apple danish. Entirely decadent, not too sweet, and totally worth it.
My new routine. Every morning after spin class I come here for an ice cafe latte, hazelnut macaroons and the French baguette (my favorite type of bread)! . Yum. Yum.

My first time here. It was good, but pricey.I had a tomato chicken sandwich. It is a big sandwich, that comes with grilled chicken,  red peppers, onions, and seasoning on a very tasty bread. It was a really good sandwich but not for $10.45. It would be a better deal if at least it came with a side. I also tried three macaroons, a chocolate, vanilla, and raspberry. They were all very good. My personal favorite was the vanilla. Which I was surprised since I am a chocolate lover and always prefer chocolates over vanilla. Overall, very nice clean cafe, however a little too pricey for what you get.
This place is my secret hideaway. I absolutely love the service, the coffee, the pastries.
Cute place with fresh pastry and good coffee. We have especially blueberry tart with tons of blueberries and very thin crust. Good stop while walking around Old Town.

Stopped here before seeing The Secondy City show nearby. Received a complimentary macaroon with my check in and ordered a hot chocolate for myself. The hot chocolate was very watery and not sweet. I have to admit I like a sweeter hot chocolate (not too sweet, but enough to be hot chocolate rather than black coffee). So that was a bummer. But the chocolate macaroon was delicious and the service was very friendly. Definitely a nice local cafe to stop at if you're in the area.
Delicious confectionary heaven. Very reasonably priced and extremely tasty. Don't miss this spot the next time you're in Chicago!
Stop be here for some coffee during a weekend trip to Chicago. Good cappuccino and good macaroons. A little on the pricey side but not too over the top.

Try not to buy a lot of stuff here, if you must. It can run up quite a large bill! The problem isn't the cost though, it's the quality. You pay a lot of money for very little.When I went there, I ordered a Crepe Suzzete and a couple macaroons. The bill was ~$25, but you have to understand that you aren't getting much. It was a snack, not a meal. The Suzzete was just a Crepe in orange juice. Although it was edible, it certainly wasn't tasty. I've had much, much better at other creperies I nearly did not finish all the Macaroons. Way too sweet. Towards the end, they all tasted the same because they are just sugar, and food coloring. If you close your eyes and take a bite out of a random Macaroon 9/10 you will guess the flavor wrong. Maybe it's because I don't have much of a sweet tooth, but nothing should be that sweet.The next dish was... oh wait, there wasn't another dish. Yup. That was it, and it was quite disappointing! I l don't think I will be returning.The saving grace for this restaurant was the great atmosphere and friendly staff. A good working environment, but it feels like a coffee shop. They fail to excel at what you went there for: crepes.
